metadata.synopsis: The InParty for Astarian while in END_Main.Morphic Pool (Arrival)Astral Plane (Just after Netherbrain Confrontation)Tadpole Choice (with Emperor in Astral Plane while making the choice to transform into a mind flayer)High Hall Interior (after Astral Plane, views of Nautiloids, Dragons, and a city in ruin)

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: I always dreamed of walking these halls, you know - enjoying the luxury of the ducal palace. And look at it now.
1.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Lord line] Last line with a smirk. He's feeling smug

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: I can't talk when we have a city to save, darling.

64.speaker: Astarion
64.text: At least the bits of it that are worth saving.

13.speaker: Astarion
13.text: Honestly, I was expecting an all-powerful brain to have a lair that was a little flashier. Not immaculately designed or anything, just to have a sense of drama to it.

14.speaker: Astarion
14.text: I really thought the stones were going to work. Our options are getting slimmer and slimmer.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: All of that and the stones didn't even work? I swear, this is never-ending.

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: So we can't wield the stones unless one of us becomes an illithid.

65.speaker: Astarion
65.text: I hope you're not actually considering this - we still have other options.
65.context: NodeContext: Player is already partially illithid

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: Why not let Karlach take the fall? She seems more than willing.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: Just consider the alternatives before throwing away that beautiful face or yours.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: Karlach seems willing to do it. It's not ideal, but there is a grim logic to it.

29.speaker: Astarion
29.text: Tell me you'll consider the alternatives? I don't want to lose you.

8.speaker: Astarion
8.text: More of an illithid, in your case.
8.context: NodeContext: Player is already partially illithid

92.speaker: Astarion
92.text: Karlach offered herself. We could just let her take the fall. That'd certainly be the easiest option.
92.context: NodeContext: Trying to be assertive, but faltering

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: Karlach has offered herself. I can't say I love the idea, but... well, there is a cruel logic to it.
84.context: NodeContext: Trying to be assertive, but faltering

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: We could free the gith prince with the Orphic Hammer. Perhaps he'll have a bright idea.
40.context: NodeContext: Trying to be assertive, but faltering

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: Maybe we should hand the stones over to the Emperor.
0.context: NodeContext: Trying to be assertive, but faltering

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I'll do it. I'll become a mind flayer - I'm not afraid.
53.context: NodeContext: Trying to be assertive, but faltering

96.speaker: Astarion
96.text: I'm going to assume you meant that as a joke. I do not want you to transform into some slimy beast.
96.context: NodeContext: Trying to be assertive, but faltering

94.speaker: Astarion
94.text: We'll figure something else out, I - I'm sure of it.
94.context: NodeContext: Trying to be assertive, but faltering

87.speaker: Astarion
87.text: Of course you will. And of course you're not.
87.context: NodeContext: Said with a sad smile (Your love just said they'd sacrifice themselves and become a mind flayer.)

110.speaker: Astarion
110.text: I wish I was surprised you'd volunteer, but I'm not. It's so perfectly... you.

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: Really? Gods, all right. Better you than me.
72.context: NodeContext: Genuinely surprised the player's sacrfiicing themselves.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: Of course you're not. When have you ever been afraid of anything?

34.speaker: Astarion
34.text: I don't think it's a good option, mind you. But we are all out of good options.

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: All right. If we're going to do this, then let's do this.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: I spoke to Karlach already - I agreed to let her transform. This is what she wants.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I don't want this for Karlach. I won't allow it.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: I won't argue with you. She's scary enough as a tiefling - I hate to think what kind of mind flayer she'd make.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: But if you won't let Karlach do it, then the final decision is in your hands.

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: I trust you with it. I just hope you know what you're doing.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Sacrifice Orpheus, sacrifice the githyanki people to an eternity of Vlaakith's tyranny. I will not allow it.

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: That narrows our choices a little, but all right. What will you allow?

31.speaker: Player
31.text: No one's turning into a mind flayer. We'll give the Emperor the stones.

38.speaker: Astarion
38.text: That is a risky move. But if you think it's the right one...

86.speaker: Astarion
86.text: All right... Let's see how this plays out.
86.context: NodeContext: Thinking (needs to be a neutral tone, the previous lines could have been anxious or encouraged).

52.speaker: Player
52.text: We got that Hammer for a reason. We'll release Orpheus.

103.speaker: Astarion
103.text: A bold move. It's a gamble, but if we play this right, it could work well for us.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I'm not sure. What do you think?

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: You're asking me? Oh, darling, I don't know - flip a coin if you need to.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: If you won't allow the gith to suffer, then let Karlach do it. She's doomed anyway, so why not?

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: Personally, I'd let Karlach do it if she's so keen. She's doomed anyway, so why not?

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: Just don't you consider transforming. The tentacles won't suit you at all, darling.

97.speaker: Astarion
97.text: If you won't allow the gith to suffer, then I'll just have to trust you'll make the right decision.

77.speaker: Astarion
77.text: Personally, I'd use the Hammer. Let Orpheus take the fall - what is he to us?

10.speaker: Astarion
10.text: However it lands, I'm sure you'll make the right choice.

91.speaker: Astarion
91.text: I'm fine with anything that keeps you from transforming into a mind flayer.

83.speaker: Astarion
83.text: I hate to say it, but if Karlach wants to do this, perhaps you should let her?

105.speaker: Astarion
105.text: But if Orpheus is off the table... well, I trust you to think of something.

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: Personally, I'd use the Hammer and take our chances with Orpheus. I'm most willing to lose him.

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: Although I understand if you feel differently about your 'prince'.

21.speaker: Astarion
21.text: But whatever you decide, I'm sure it'll be the right call.

76.speaker: Astarion
76.text: Alas, you don't have any easy options.

49.speaker: Astarion
49.text: All right, we can do this. We have to do this.
49.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn line] Psyching himself up

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: You always pick the most romantic spots to chat.

61.speaker: Astarion
61.text: Let's be quick - our metaphorical clock is ticking.

67.speaker: Astarion
67.text: Anything on your mind? Impending doom, perhaps?

104.speaker: Player
104.text: This might be the end. I hate that I never got to kiss you.

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: As do I. After all, forbidden fruit always tastes the sweetest.

45.speaker: Astarion
45.text: You'd just better survive this, because when it's done, we are going to find a way to taste each other.

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: Just think of it as motivation to survive. Because if we find a way to overcome this, we can find a way to overcome those spicy lips of yours.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: Come on, my love. Let's show them what we can do.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: This might be our last chance to share a kiss.
73.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Lord line] It's funny, because the player is a monster now! ("That" referring to their face)

58.speaker: Player
58.text: This might be our last chance to share a kiss.
58.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Lord line] It's funny, because the player is a monster now! ("That" referring to their face)

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: Ha! Oh, my love. You can't expect me to kiss that now, can you?
6.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Lord line] It's funny, because the player is a monster now! ("That" referring to their face)

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: No, our kissing days are done, so let's focus on defeating the brain. Otherwise this whole mess will have been for nothing.
90.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Lord line] "this whole mess" again referring to the player's face.

85.speaker: Astarion
85.text: Oh - actually, I think the last time we kissed was our last chance to share a kiss.
85.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn line] Player asked for a kiss, but they're a mind flayer. Astarion trying to decline without being TOO rude

79.speaker: Astarion
79.text: No offence, but... I mean, how would that even work now?
79.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn line] "how would kissing a mind flayer work"

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: Then we'd better make it count.

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: You've never tasted so sweet, darling.

95.speaker: Astarion
95.text: You've never tasted so sweet, darling.

23.text: You've never tasted so sweet, darling.

35.speaker: Astarion
35.text: You've never tasted so sweet, darling.

93.speaker: Astarion
93.text: We'd better survive this, because I never want to stop doing that.

99.speaker: Astarion
99.text: We'd better survive this, because I never want to stop doing that.

75.speaker: Astarion
75.text: We'd better survive this, because I never want to stop doing that.

26.speaker: Astarion
26.text: We'd better survive this, because I never want to stop doing that.

17.text: We'd better survive this, because I never want to stop doing that.
17.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn line] "doing that" = Kissing the player

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: We'd better survive this, because I never want to stop doing that.
9.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn line] "doing that" = Kissing the player

102.speaker: Player
102.text: How do you feel about my transformation?

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: I admit, I'm a little torn. You are repulsive, but just think of all the power you can access. It's a compelling mixture in an ally.

88.speaker: Astarion
88.text: I do miss your pretty face, though.

11.speaker: Astarion
11.text: It's certainly... different. It will take some getting used to.

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: I admit, I did love the person you were, but I understand why you made this choice.

39.speaker: Astarion
39.text: Aside from my once-beautiful lover turning into a monster? Oh, wonderful.

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: Oh, as well as can be expected when facing down the end of the world.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Do you think we can win this?

3.speaker: Astarion
3.text: But of course! With my power and your tentacles, how could we lose?

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: I can't say. All I know is that by transforming, you've given us our best possible chance to survive this.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: Please, darling, you have the Vampire Ascendant on your side. How could we lose?

66.speaker: Astarion
66.text: I can't say for sure, but we've come through a lot already. It would hardly do to fail now.

98.speaker: Astarion
98.text: I always dreamed of walking these halls, you know.
98.context: NodeContext: [Vampire Spawn line] A little wistfully

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: My dreams never included a giant brain or smouldering ruins, but I'll take what I can get.

106.speaker: Astarion
106.text: Look at this place. From a symbol of the city's power and grandeur to a brain-infested husk.

68.speaker: Astarion
68.text: Maybe I should help fund the repairs when this is all over. It would be the civic-minded thing to do.

108.speaker: Astarion
108.text: And it means we could install secret tunnels, spy holes, maybe even a murder pit. Everything we'd need to rule from the shadows.
